abstract: Wildfires in Australia are stymieing a University of Michigan team's effort to become the first Americans to win the World Solar Challenge since its inaugural running in 1987.
snippet: Wildfires in Australia are stymieing a University of Michigan team's effort to become the first Americans to win the World Solar Challenge since its inaugural running in 1987.
lead_paragraph: A wildfire has introduced an unexpected variable in the World Solar Challenge, stymieing the progress of the primary American entry in the race. The University of Michigan's car, named Quantum, sat in third place behind Japanese and Dutch entries, respectively, when the fire put a halt to the 1,800-mile caravan across the Australian outback on Monday morning.

headline.main: Delayed Down Under, a Michigan Team Recharges in the World Solar Challenge
